greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pascal's triangle (excluding first, last three elements of each row) read by rows, row n read mod n.
comment: Prime numbered rows contain all zeros.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=6..100 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Table[Mod[Binomial[n, k], n], {n, 6, 20}, {k, 3, n-3}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 17 2014 *)
program: a053203_tabl = zipWith (\k row -> take (k - 5) $ drop 3 row)
results.author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu), Dec 12 1999
ext: a(30) corrected by _T. D. Noe_, Feb 08 2008
